required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Dose Escalation Study in de Novo Renal Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Month, Randomized, Controlled, Dose Escalation Study Evaluating Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics (PK) and Pharmacodynamics (PD) of an Anti-CD2 Monoclonal Antibody, TCD601, in de Novo Renal Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of escalating doses of TCD601 in de novo renal transplant patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0.
Measure Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) over time.
primary_outcome.description: The maximum (peak) observed plasma, blood, serum, or other body fluid drug concentration after single dose administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC).
primary_outcome.description: The AUC from time zero to the last measurable concentration sampling time.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure peripheral CD2-receptor occupancy following TCD601 administration over time.
primary_outcome.description: Receptor Occupancy will be reported as the % of target saturation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess changes in peripheral immunophenotype, including T-, B-, and NK-cells, via Fluorescence-activated Cell Sorter (FACS) over time.
Measure anti-TCD601 antibodies in serum via Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent (ELISA) assay over time.

arm_group.description: TCD601 administered with the contemporary standard of care (SoC) consisting of concentration-controlled tacrolimus (TAC) combined with mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) and corticosteroids (CS).
TCD601 administered with the contemporary standard of care (SoC) consisting of concentration-controlled tacrolimus (TAC) combined with mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) and corticosteroids (CS).
TCD601 administered with the contemporary standard of care (SoC) consisting of concentration-controlled tacrolimus (TAC) combined with mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) and corticosteroids (CS).
TCD601 administered with the contemporary standard of care (SoC) consisting of concentration-controlled tacrolimus (TAC) combined with mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) and corticosteroids (CS).

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to understand the study requirements and provide written informed consent before and study assessment is performed.
- Male or female patients â‰¥ 18 to 70 years of age.
- Recipients of a de novo renal allograft from a heart-beating deceased, living unrelated, or non-HLA identical living related donor.
- Recipients of a kidney with a cold ischemia time (CIT) less than 30 hours.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple-organ transplant recipients
- Subjects who have received a kidney allograft previously
- Recipient of a kidney from an HLA identical living related donor
- Recipient of a kidney from a donor after cardiac death
- Subjects at high immunological risk for rejection
